related_questions.question: What is the difference between a subsidiary and an affiliate?
related_questions.snippet: A subsidiary is a company whose parent is a majority shareholder that owns more than 50% of all shares. For corporate, securities and capital markets, an affiliate is a person or entity directly or indirectly controlling, being controlled by, or under common control with another person or entity.Apr 14, 2019

answer_box.title: Affiliated entity — AccountingTools
answer_box.snippet: An affiliated entity is an organization that directly or indirectly controls another entity, or is directly or indirectly controlled by another entity, or which is under common control alongside another entity. Thus, an affiliated entity could be a parent company or a subsidiary company.
